Reviews.Title: “Hot and Cold Running Prostitutes!”
Reviews.Author: Clembo1957
Reviews.Content: If you're travelling on a budget and don't mind noise 24/7 this place is for you, otherwise forget it. The hotel is located at the lower end of La Rambla and especially at weekends the noise outside is 24/7 with late night revellers until 7am being replaced by tourists. Pension Picasso is located up several flights of stairs, entry is via a buzzer at the external door, then an internal door, the external door is usually open during the day but entry can be difficult if no one is on reception at night (supposedly open 24 hours a day). The receptionist had a shaky grasp of English but at least it was better than my Spanish! My room was a single with a shared bathroom overlooking La Rambla, small but clean with a sink, a TV that worked when it felt like it and a hard bed that gave me back ache. There is a WC near to reception and a bathroom with shower down the corridor, however the door didn't close or lock properly so i didn't use this! Returning to the hotel after midnight i was constantly harrassed by Prostitutes outside the hotel and the noise outside was constant, the only way to get any sleep was to get drunk and pass out! The room also shared a balcony with the room next door so there was a privacy issue there also, with people sitting outside my window! When i did check out there was no one on reception so i left my key and departed. Pro's: Very Cheap, clean room, location Cons: location, Everything else The Picasso is cheap but thats the only thing it's got going for it, if you're a student on a budget and want to be out all night fine, for everyone else not recommended. cheap and nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nasty”
Reviews.Author: michielg Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: One should be able to get budget accommodation further from town centre that is more bearable. How bad are the hotels rated worse than this place?! It is cheap and convenient but i cringe if i had to use the toilet. I didnt even have a shower as i rather stayed dirty! maybe a room with a bathroom would have been better as you wouldn't have to deal with other people's wee and puke.

Reviews.Title: “the house of the rising sun!”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Good: as regards price: 100% cheap as regards the service: 89%% helpful & attentive. as regards location? 100% perfect central, great for hopping on the metro, shops, funny street performers &buying fresh food at the famous Boccaria market! Bad: a)during the night: howling drunks, prostitute hassling tourists b)the place needs a DIY man!

Reviews.Title: “simply disaster”
Reviews.Author: timisoara2008
Reviews.Content: I have spent only 1 night it was a horrible experience. starting with the fact that I reserved the room with booking.com for 55 euro and for my curiosity i asked at reception what is the price for a room. SURPRISE 45 EURO :)) the room was awful, no window, the walls filled with mold, the bathroom was infected terrible experience. I didn't had much expectation being a hostel but also it has to besome minimum conditions of hygiene

Reviews.Title: “For 30euros a night - more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: lptravellergirl
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was somewhat apprehensive about staying here - however considering my budget, my late booking and preference to being somewhere central I decided to go with it - it was only for 2 nights. The rooms are small and the staff don't really speak English (however, bear in mind you're in SPAIN not ENGLAND! And are you really in Barcelona to sit in your room?!) The staff weren't unhelpful, they just had other jobs to do - for 30 euros a night, don't expect a concierge service, use your guide book. I had a room on La Ramblas, yes it was noisy but not as bad as many of the reviews made out - I slept soundly for 8 hours. The bed was very comfortable and they even gave me an extra pillow when I asked. The room had been cleaned when I arrived and there was evidnence during my stay that they cleaned the communal showers and toilets. I wouldn't necessarily stay again but I would recommend it to someone who wants a budget stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here even if its your only option!”
Reviews.Author: tleslie85
Reviews.Content: I would strongly suggest not staying here ever! It is three flights of narrow stairs up to the reception, where the receptionist didnt speak english and the one that did was not helpful at all. The place is very run down and lots of things could do with being replaced or fixed. The shower on our level was broken and you had to hold it up yourself to use it, out of the two toilets on our floor only one was useable. Our room didnt have a window and when trying to use the power outlet, sparks came out.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Picasso”
Reviews.Author: KarlosFandango68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pension Picasso for a long weekend after reading a few reports posted on varius web sites. It is cheap OK and bang in the middle of the Rambla but If you plan on visiting Barcelona do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else. The external door at night is surrounded by prostitues and pick pockets. The staff are unfriendly to the point of being rude the safes don't work in most rooms and the shower on the floor we stayed on has a step down past a large open window that is damn right dangerous. The allyway at the side is noisy well into the morning. The photo's on most sites of this place are nothing like what you get when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Not good but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: FrankieMars42
Reviews.Content: The place was quite hard to find and once we got there the lady on reception was really grumpy. She didn´t show us where the shower or toilet was (thankfully we found the latter after exploring a little but still couldn´t find the shower). The room was tiny but did have a double bed (a rarity in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect to sleep a wink!”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveller71
Reviews.Content: This pension couldnt be in a better location for visiting the Ramblas area of Barcelona by DAY unfortunately when you return to your accomodation at NIGHT you will find you are situated in the dodgiest RED LIGHT AREA and it has a completly different feel. I was astonished to find a hole in the wall at the side of the hotel which is a "bar" with the whole street becoming incredibly LOUD street party style every night. Do not expect to sleep a wink till at least 8am due to the noise then get woke up at 12 by the maid. What was supposed to be a rest for me ended up wearing me out!! This place is more suited to late night party animals than quiet couples wanting a quiet break. However if your idea of soaking up the local culture involves getting oral by a black transvestite hooker this hotel could not be better situated. Enjoy your stay!
